alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 11:51PM EDT until August 09 at 11:47AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTILATE TONIGHTL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Presumpscot River at West Falmouth. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding affects storage yards of industrial businesses on Warren Avenue in Westbrook. Property should be relocated to places which are 5 feet higher than nearby river banks to avoid being flooded or isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - The river will be cresting after midnight. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
